result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:05 AM Defendant Miguel A Torres Ortiz in court with attorney Jacob A. Maule.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Voge, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Case called for plea and sentencing hearing.  State recites plea agreement.  Court conducts plea colloquy.  Case dismissed and read in to 17CM1539.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2021 at 09:30 am.

10:41 AM Defendant Miguel A Torres Ortiz in court with attorney Jacob A. Maule.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appears as interperter in this matter who is sworn in.  
Atty Maule state this matter is ready for a plea and sentencing.
Atty Maule notes matter was set for 8:30 am and due to court unavailabilty this matter has just been called. 
State does not object to a plea and sentencing being set. 
Court sets matter for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2021 at 09:30 am.

  ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 07-22-21.** Adjournment request will be discussed at the status hearing. MAM

Motion in limine-State's
Motion in limine-State's

Jury status hearing on July 29, 2021 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 3, 2021 at 08:30 am.

08:58 AM Defendant Miguel A Torres Ortiz in court with attorney Jacob A. Maule.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant authorized earlier this week.  Defense has received discovery.  Court addresses States motion for joinder.  Arguments by the State.  Arguments by the Defense.  Court grants the motion for joinder.  Court grants the motion to adjourn the trial.  Jury trial with all  three cases joined is expected to last 3 days.  Motions in limine, proposed jury instructions and witness lists are due a minimum of 48 hours prior  to the jury status hearing.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 29, 2021 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 3, 2021 at 08:30 am.

09:27 AM Attorney Jacob A. Maule in court.   Defendant Miguel A Torres Ortiz did not appear.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan was scheduled as interpreter and was on his way to the courthouse but was not here when the case was called.  Defense requests to appear by authorization.  State objects to proceeding without the defendant present.  Based on defendant's non-appearance Court orders capias STAYED until the end of the week.  If the court is not notified by counsel that the defendant has been found and provided a current address by that time Court will issue the capias and revoke and forfeit bail.

Letter dated 04-26-21 requesting adjournment filed by plaintiff.
  ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 04-26-21.** Please schedule for a status conference to address rescheduling.

Letter to Court regarding Defendant's Attendance at Motion Hearing
  ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 04-23-21.** Based upon the nature of the hearing, the defendant must appear in person.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Hearing on March 29, 2021 at 01:30 pm.

10:40 AM Attorney Addison Kuhn in court.   Defendant Miguel A Torres Ortiz did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Abby Rockendorf, appeared by Zoom (video) for the State of Wisconsin. Patrick Ryan appeared in court as interpreter.  Defense has no indication of their clients whereabouts.  State requests capias; bail revoked and forfeited.  Defense objects to capias.  Based on defendant's non-appearance Court orders capias.  Court orders bail revoked and forfeited.  Case recalled at 11:02 am.  Defendant appeared in court.  Interpreter is no longer present.  Court quashes warrant and reinstates bail.  Hearing scheduled for March 29, 2021 at 01:30 pm.

10:52 AM Defendant Miguel A Torres Ortiz in court with attorney Pablo Galaviz in court as a Friend of the Court.  Shawn N Woller appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared in court as interpreter.  The parties agreed to have the hearing conducted remotely under the Standing COVID-19 Order requirements. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Attorney Galaviz represented the defendant previously but has not been active in this matter for a while.  Defendant advises he will hire private counsel.  Attorney Galaviz to be removed as counsel of record.  Defendant to appear in person for the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 22, 2021 at 10:00 am.
